chinese_phrase: 我见这血，就**越过**你们去
sentence_context: The blood shall be a sign for you, on the houses where you are. And when I see the blood, I will **pass over** you, and no plague will befall you to destroy you, when I strike the land of Egypt.
nuance_note: Pass over (Pasach) 是救赎历史专有名词，Skip 太随意。

chinese_phrase: 只管**站住**！看耶和华...施行救恩
sentence_context: And Moses said to the people, “Do not be afraid; **stand firm**, and see the salvation of the Lord, which he will work for you today. For the Egyptians whom you see today, you shall never see again.
nuance_note: Stand firm 带有军事意味（坚守阵地），Stand there 只是发呆。

phrase_cn: 我下来是要救他们脱离埃及人的手
phrase_en: I have come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians
sentence_context: and I have come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians and to bring them up out of that land to a good and broad land, a land flowing with milk and honey, to the place of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
nuance_note: “拯救” (Deliver) here means to rescue from oppression and slavery through divine intervention, not merely to 'save money' or 'rescue a lost item'.

phrase_cn: 我要使他的心刚硬
phrase_en: I will harden his heart
sentence_context: And the LORD said to Moses, “When you go back to Egypt, see that you do before Pharaoh all the wonders that I have put in your power. But I will harden his heart, so that he will not let the people go.
nuance_note: “使...刚硬” (Harden) refers to spiritual stubbornness and resistance to God's will and commands, not merely 'allowing' something to be difficult.

phrase_cn: 容我的百姓去，好事奉我
phrase_en: Let my people go, that they may serve me
sentence_context: And you shall say to him, ‘The LORD, the God of the Hebrews, sent me to you, saying, “Let my people go, that they may serve me in the wilderness,” and behold, you have not listened by now.
nuance_note: “事奉” (Serve) implies worship, obedience, and devotion to God as a covenantal relationship, distinct from serving food or serving time.

phrase_cn: 我要伸出膀臂救赎你们
phrase_en: I will redeem you with an outstretched arm
sentence_context: Say therefore to the people of Israel, ‘I am the LORD, and I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians, and I will deliver you from slavery to them, and I will redeem you with an outstretched arm and with great acts of judgment.
nuance_note: “救赎” (Redeem) signifies God's powerful act of liberation and taking ownership of His people, not a commercial transaction or saving money.

phrase_cn: 又当为我造圣所，使我可以住在他们中间
phrase_en: And let them make me a sanctuary, that I may dwell in their midst
sentence_context: “They shall make a sanctuary for me, and I will dwell in their midst. Exactly as I show you concerning the pattern of the tabernacle, and all its furniture, so you shall make it.
nuance_note: “居住” (Dwell) here denotes God's covenantal and intimate presence among His people, not mere physical cohabitation or temporary residence.

phrase_cn: 你要用十幅幔子做帐幕
phrase_en: Moreover, you shall make the tabernacle with ten curtains
sentence_context: “Moreover, you shall make the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine twined linen and blue and purple and scarlet yarns; you shall make them with cherubim skillfully worked into them.
nuance_note: “会幕” (Tabernacle) is a sacred, portable sanctuary meticulously designed by God for His dwelling among Israel, far more significant than a common 'tent' or 'house'.

phrase_cn: 你们要将这日定为纪念
phrase_en: This day shall be to you a memorial
sentence_context: “This day shall be to you a memorial, and you shall keep it as a feast to the LORD; throughout your generations, you shall keep it as an ordinance forever.
trap: Recall (a fact), Keep in mind (a task)
nuance_note: “纪念” (Memorial/Remember) signifies an active, commemorative observance that reinforces the covenant and God's saving acts, not just a passive recollection of a fact.

phrase_cn: 我要将石版，并我所写的律法和诫命赐给你
phrase_en: I will give you the tablets of stone, with the law and the commandment
sentence_context: The LORD said to Moses, “Come up to me on the mountain and wait there, that I may give you the tablets of stone, with the law and the commandment, which I have written for their instruction.”
nuance_note: “律法” (Torah) encompasses God's divine instruction, covenant, and way of life, not merely a set of 'rules' or 'regulations'.

phrase_cn: 摩西将耶和华为以色列的缘故向法老和埃及人所行的一切事，以及路上所遭遇的一切艰难，并耶和华怎样拯救他们，都述说给他的岳父听。
phrase_en: Moses told his father-in-law all that the LORD had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel's sake, all the hardship that had come upon them in the way, and how the LORD had delivered them.
sentence_context: Moses told his father-in-law all that the LORD had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel's sake, all the hardship that had come upon them in the way, and how the LORD had delivered them.
trap: Get out of trouble, Escape (a situation)
nuance_note: “拯救” (Deliver) here emphasizes God's mighty and supernatural intervention in rescuing His people from overwhelming oppression, not just 'getting out of trouble'.

phrase_cn: 你们要事奉耶和华你们的神
phrase_en: You shall serve the LORD your God
sentence_context: You shall serve the LORD your God, and he will bless your bread and your water, and I will take sickness away from among you.
nuance_note: “事奉” (Serve) implies active devotion, obedience, and worship as a response to God's covenant, rather than simply 'working for' or being 'useful to' someone.

phrase_cn: 你凭慈爱引导你所**赎**的百姓；你凭能力引他们到你的圣所。
phrase_en: You have led in your steadfast love the people whom you have **redeemed**;
sentence_context: You have led in your steadfast love the people whom you have redeemed; you have guided them by your strength to your holy abode.
nuance_note: The Hebrew verb גָּאַל (ga'al) denotes acting as a kinsman-redeemer, involving liberation and restoration, not just a financial transaction.

phrase_cn: 我要在以色列人中间**居住**，作他们的神。
phrase_en: I will **dwell** among the people of Israel and will be their God.
sentence_context: I will dwell among the people of Israel and will be their God.
nuance_note: The verb שָׁכַן (shakan) describes God's immanent presence, specifically in the Tabernacle (His dwelling place), signifying His covenant relationship with His people.

phrase_cn: **当记念**安息日，守为圣日。
phrase_en: **Remember** the Sabbath day, to keep it holy.
sentence_context: Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy.
nuance_note: The command to זָכַר (zakhar) means more than mental recall; it implies active observance and commemoration, making the Sabbath a distinct sign of the covenant.

phrase_cn: 耶和华使法老的心**刚硬**，不听他们，正如耶和华对摩西所说的。
phrase_en: But the Lord **hardened** the heart of Pharaoh, and he did not listen to them,
sentence_context: But the Lord hardened the heart of Pharaoh, and he did not listen to them, just as the Lord had spoken to Moses.
nuance_note: The Hebrew verb חָזַק (khazaq) here means God actively strengthened Pharaoh's resolve, demonstrating divine sovereignty even over human will, fulfilling prophetic declaration.

phrase_cn: 不要惧怕，只管站住！看耶和华今天向你们所要施行的**拯救**。
phrase_en: and see the **salvation** of the Lord, which he will work for you today.
sentence_context: And Moses said to the people, “Do not be afraid; stand firm, and see the salvation of the Lord, which he will work for you today. For the Egyptians whom you see today, you shall never see again.”
nuance_note: The Hebrew יְשׁוּעָה (yeshu'ah) refers to a comprehensive act of rescue and victory, not just saving from a difficult situation but bringing to safety and freedom.

phrase_cn: 当时，云彩遮盖会幕，耶和华的荣光就充满了**帐幕**。
phrase_en: and the glory of the Lord filled the **tabernacle**.
sentence_context: Then the cloud covered the tent of meeting, and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle.
nuance_note: The מִשְׁכָּן (mishkan) is more than a temporary tent; it is a divinely designed dwelling place for God's glory among His people, symbolizing His covenant presence.

phrase_cn: 法老的臣仆对法老说：“这人作我们的网罗要到几时呢？容这些人去**事奉**耶和华他们的神吧！埃及已经败坏了，你还不晓得吗？”
phrase_en: Let the men go, that they may **serve** the Lord their God.
sentence_context: Then Pharaoh's servants said to him, “How long shall this man be a snare to us? Let the men go, that they may serve the Lord their God. Do you not yet understand that Egypt is ruined?”
nuance_note: The Hebrew עָבַד (avad) means to serve or worship, implying obedience, devotion, and labor offered to God, distinguishing Israel from their bondage in Egypt.

phrase_cn: 你在百姓面前所要立的**典章**是这样：
phrase_en: Now these are the **rules** that you shall set before them.
sentence_context: Now these are the rules that you shall set before them.
nuance_note: The Hebrew מִשְׁפָּטִים (mishpatim) refers to legal judgments or ordinances, specific applications of the broader Torah (Law), designed to govern societal and individual behavior.

phrase_cn: 凡头生的驴，你要用羊羔**代赎**；若不代赎，就要打折它的颈项。凡你儿子中头生的，都要赎出来。
phrase_en: Every firstborn of a donkey you shall **redeem** with a lamb,
sentence_context: Every firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb, or if you will not redeem it you shall break its neck. Every firstborn of man among your sons you shall redeem.
nuance_note: This commandment illustrates the principle of substitutionary redemption (פָּדָה padah), where a life (lamb) is offered to claim another (donkey's firstborn), pointing to a greater spiritual redemption.

phrase_cn: 摩西对百姓说：“你们要**记念**从埃及为奴之家出来的这日，因为耶和华用大能的手将你们从这地方领出来。
phrase_en: **Remember** this day in which you came out from Egypt, from the house of slavery,
sentence_context: Then Moses said to the people, “Remember this day in which you came out from Egypt, from the house of slavery, for by a strong hand the Lord brought you out from this place. No leavened bread shall be eaten.”
nuance_note: The imperative זָכַר (zakhar) here is a call to active commemoration of God's mighty deliverance (יָד חֲזָקָה), ensuring the historical event shapes future identity and obedience.

phrase_cn: 我所有的长子都要赎出来。
phrase_en: and all the firstborn of my sons I redeem.
sentence_context: For when Pharaoh stubbornly refused to let us go, the Lord killed all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both the firstborn of man and the firstborn of animal. Therefore I sacrifice to the Lord all the males that first open the womb, and all the firstborn of my sons I redeem.
nuance_note: The act of 'redeeming' the firstborn son signifies God's ownership and Israel's deliverance, requiring a symbolic payment.

phrase_cn: 我要使法老的心刚硬
phrase_en: But I will harden Pharaoh's heart
sentence_context: But I will harden Pharaoh's heart, and though I multiply my signs and my wonders in the land of Egypt...
nuance_note: God's active role in 'hardening' Pharaoh's heart demonstrates His sovereignty and judgment, not merely passive permission.

phrase_cn: 当日耶和华这样拯救以色列人脱离埃及人的手
phrase_en: Thus the Lord saved Israel that day from the hand of the Egyptians
sentence_context: Thus the Lord saved Israel that day from the hand of the Egyptians, and Israel saw the Egyptians dead on the seashore.
nuance_note: The 'deliverance' (salvation) of Israel was a powerful, miraculous act of God, establishing His covenant faithfulness.

phrase_cn: 容我的儿子去事奉我吧！
phrase_en: Let my son go that he may serve me.
sentence_context: Then you shall say to Pharaoh, ‘Thus says the Lord, Israel is my firstborn son, and I say to you, “Let my son go that he may serve me.” If you refuse to let him go, behold, I will kill your firstborn son.’
nuance_note: To 'serve' God implies worship and obedience, a profound allegiance distinct from slavery or generic service.

phrase_cn: 使我可以住在他们中间。
phrase_en: that I might dwell among them
sentence_context: And they shall know that I am the Lord their God, who brought them out of the land of Egypt that I might dwell among them; I am the Lord their God.
nuance_note: God's 'dwelling' among His people signifies His holy, covenantal presence and desire for intimate relationship, not just physical proximity.

phrase_cn: 在你眼前作记念
phrase_en: as a memorial between your eyes
sentence_context: And it shall be to you as a sign on your hand and as a memorial between your eyes, that the law of the Lord may be in your mouth. For with a strong hand the Lord has brought you out of Egypt.
nuance_note: The 'memorial' serves as a perpetual, commanded reminder of God's powerful deliverance and Israel's obligation to obey His Law.

phrase_cn: 你们若实在听从我的话，遵守我的约
phrase_en: if you will indeed obey my voice and keep my covenant
sentence_context: Now therefore, if you will indeed obey my voice and keep my covenant, you shall be my treasured possession among all peoples, for all the earth is mine.
nuance_note: 'Keeping' the covenant involves a deep commitment and obedience to God's commands, establishing Israel's unique relationship with Him.

phrase_cn: 凡寻求耶和华的，就到营外的会幕那里去。
phrase_en: And everyone who sought the Lord would go out to the tent of meeting
sentence_context: Now Moses used to take the tent and pitch it outside the camp, far off from the camp, and he called it the tent of meeting. And everyone who sought the Lord would go out to the tent of meeting, which was outside the camp.
nuance_note: 'Seeking the Lord' at the Tent of Meeting implies an intentional act of worship and communion, desiring His presence and guidance.
